2.text: Suffer me a little, and I will shew thee : for I have yet somewhat to speak in Godâ€™s behalf.

3.text: I will repeat my knowledge from the beginning, and I will prove my Maker just.

4.text: For indeed my words are without a lie, and perfect knowledge shall be proved to thee.

5.text: God doth not cast away the mighty, whereas he himself also is mighty.

6.text: But he saveth not the wicked, and he giveth judgment to the poor.

7.text: He will not take away his eyes from the just, and he placeth kings on the throne for ever, and they are exalted.

8.text: And if they shall be in chains, and be bound with the cords of poverty :

9.text: He shall shew them their works, and their wicked deeds, because they have been violent.

10.text: He also shall open their ear, to correct them : and shall speak, that they may return from iniquity.

11.text: If they shall hear and observe, they shall accomplish their days in good, and their years in glory.

12.text: But if they hear not, they shall pass by the sword, and shall be consumed in folly.

13.text: Dissemblers and crafty men prove the wrath of God, neither shall they cry when they are bound.

14.text: Their soul shall die in a storm, and their life among the effeminate.

15.text: He shall deliver the poor out of his distress, and shall open his ear in affliction.

16.text: Therefore he shall set thee at large out of the narrow mouth, and which hath no foundation under it : and the rest of thy table shall be full of fatness.

17.text: Thy cause hath been judged as that of the wicked, cause and judgment thou shalt recover.

18.text: Therefore let not anger overcome thee to oppress any man : neither let multitude of gifts turn thee aside.

19.text: Lay down thy greatness without tribulation, and all the mighty of strength.

20.text: Prolong not the night that people may come up for them.

21.text: Beware thou turn not aside to iniquity : for this thou hast begun to follow after misery.

22.text: Behold, God is high in his strength, and none is like him among the lawgivers.

23.text: Who can search out his ways? or who can say to him : Thou has wrought iniquity?

24.text: Remember that thou knowest not his work, concerning which men have sung.

25.text: All men see him, every one beholdeth afar off.

26.text: Behold, God is great, exceeding our knowledge : the number of his years is inestimable.

27.text: He lifteth up the drops of rain, and poureth out showers like floods :

28.text: Which flow from the clouds that cover all above.

29.text: If he will spread out clouds as his tent,

30.text: And lighten with his light from above, he shall cover also the ends of the sea.

31.text: For by these he judgeth people, and giveth food to many mortals.

32.text: In his hands he hideth the light, and commandeth it to come again.

33.text: He sheweth his friend concerning it, that it is his possession, and that he may come up to it.
